metadata.title: CVE-2022-32166 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In ovs versions v0.90.0 through v2.5.0 are vulnerable to heap bufferover-read in flow.c. An unsafe comparison of “minimasks” function couldlead access to an unmapped region of memory. This vulnerability is capableof crashing the software, memory modification, and possible remoteexecution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-pki - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-source - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-switch - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-test - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-vtep - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
python3-openvswitch - 2.13.8-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.13.8-0ubuntu1').
